description: Where the type for a question is "Reference", indicates a type of resource that is permitted.

element.comment: This extension only has meaning if the question.type = Reference.  If no allowedResource extensions are present, the presumption is that any type of resource is permitted.  If multiple are present, then any of the specified types are permitted.  See additional guidance and examples in the [SDC implementation guide](http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/sdc/behavior.html#referenceResource).
element.definition: Where the type for a question is "Reference", indicates a type of resource that is permitted.

mapping.map: N/A - MIF rather than RIM level

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

name: referenceResource

If multiple are present, then any of the specified types are permitted. element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).
